concept.title: Uninstalling the Native Client
concept.shortdesc: The native client can be uninstalled in different ways, depending on your operating system.

conbody.section: Linux and SolarisOn Linux and Solaris, the native client can be uninstalled by deleting the NativeClient_xxxx product directory and all of its subdirectories.

section.title: Windows
section.p: The native client can be uninstalled on Windows using either the MSI installer graphical interface, its command-line interface, or through the Windows Control Panel.

p.b: Using the MSI Installer Graphical Interface

ol.li: Double-click the MSI file, then click Next in the Setup Wizard screen.
In the following screen, click the Remove button.
In the next screen, click the Remove button and then click Finish.

section.p: This is the MSI command-line syntax for a quiet uninstall:
The following table lists common msiexec command-line options for use with NativeClient_xxxx.msi , along with an explanation of their usage. For a list of all command-line options, enter msiexec/?.
As described in Installing on Windows Using the MSI Command-Line, the /x option uninstalls the product.

ol.li: From the Control Panel, open Add or Remove Programs.
